title: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda (Department of Elections)

communications.subject: Delaware Freedom of Information Act Request: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda (Department of Elections)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Delaware Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting data on local ballot initiatives/referenda that took place in the state since 1972. Specifically, I need the following information to be included in the data.

1. Text of the ballot initiative/referendum
2. Local government where the election took place.
3. County where the local government is located
4. Election date
5. Result of election (votes for, votes against, pass/fail)
6. Threshold to pass (50%, two-thirds, etc)

This website from California provides a good example of the type of data I am requesting:
https://data.ca.gov/dataset/election-data/resource/67e83a65-2b55-41ec-9420-b33b666d4711

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jonathan Rudenberg, a citizen of Delaware, in coordination with Jimin Han.

communications.subject: RE: Delaware Freedom of Information Act Request: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda (Department of Elections)
communications.communication:
Dear Johnathan Rudenberg –

The Department has received your FOIA request, below.  Please be advised the Department does not possess any records responsive to your request.  Delaware does not include ballot initiatives/referenda on ballots.

The Department does not maintain municipal election records.  For these records you may wish to contact Delaware’s municipalities.  Links to Delaware’s municipalities’ websites are available on the Department’s Municipal Elections webpage, https://elections.delaware.gov/municipality/index.shtml.

Thank you very much.

Best,


Cathleen Hartsky-Carter

Community Relations Officer/FOIA Coordinator

State of Delaware Department of Elections

905 S Governors Ave, Suite 170

Dover, DE 19904

302-739-4277

https://elections.delaware.gov<https://elections.delaware.gov/>

https://ivote.de.gov<https://ivote.de.gov/>
[cid:image002.png@01DA6FCD.37C69170]

title: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda (hawaii secretary of state)

communications.subject: Hawaii Uniform Information Practices Act Request: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda (hawaii secretary of state)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Hawaii Uniform Information Practices Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting data on local ballot initiatives/referenda that took place in the state since 1972. Specifically, I need the following information to be included in the data.

1. Text of the ballot initiative/referendum
2. Local government where the election took place.
3. County where the local government is located
4. Election date
5. Result of election (votes for, votes against, pass/fail)
6. Threshold to pass (50%, two-thirds, etc)

This website from California provides a good example of the type of data I am requesting:
https://data.ca.gov/dataset/election-data/resource/67e83a65-2b55-41ec-9420-b33b666d4711

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jimin Han

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] Hawaii Uniform Information Practices Act Request: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda (hawaii secretary of state)
communications.communication:
Hi,

You have contacted the Business Registration Division, Department of Commerce and Consumer Affairs.
https://cca.hawaii.gov/breg/   We register corporations, limited liability companies, partnerships, trade names,
trademarks, service marks and publicity rights names.

Please contact the State Office of Elections at: (808) 453-VOTE or (808) 453-8683.
Email address: elections@hawaii.gov<mailto:elections@hawaii.gov>
The website for Office of Elections is https://elections.hawaii.gov/


Thank you,
Emily Wen
Documents Information Section
Business Registration Office
(808) 586-2727 option #1

title: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda (Alabama Secretary of State)

communications.communication:

1. Text of the ballot initiative/referendum
2. Local government where the election took place.
3. County where the local government is located
4. Election date

This website from California provides a good example of the type of data I am requesting:

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

communications.subject: RE: Alabama Open Records Law Request: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda (Alabama Secretary of State)
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

Thank you for reaching out to the Alabama Secretary of State’s office.

This Office requires that all requests for public records be properly submitted using the official Public Records Request Form at the link below.

https://www.sos.alabama.gov/index.php/public-records-request

Sincerely,

Laney Rawls
Executive Assistant/Director of Scheduling
Office of Secretary of State Wes Allen
Alabama State Capitol
600 Dexter Avenue, Suite S-105
Montgomery, AL 36130
Laney.Rawls@sos.alabama.gov<mailto:Laney.Rawls@sos.alabama.gov>
Office: (334) 353-2171

[cid:image004.png@01DA6FC8.0B1B1EC0]<https://www.facebook.com/alasecretaryofstate/> [cid:image005.png@01DA6FC8.0B1B1EC0] <https://twitter.com/alasecofstate>  [cid:image006.png@01DA6FC8.0B1B1EC0] <https://www.sos.alabama.gov/>
